DataElement.preferredName: Breast Cancer AJCC Edition 8 Pathologic Regional Lymph Node N Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the regional lymph node involvement for breast carcinoma based on clinical stage information combined with operative findings, and evidence obtained from pathology review when surgery is the first definitive therapy, using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Questionnaire Domain Breast Neoplasm Pathologic N Category
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire._One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest._A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire.

Concepts.longName: Questionnaire Domain
Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire.

Property.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.:Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

Concepts.longName: Breast
Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Concepts.longName: Neoplasm
Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Concepts.longName: Pathologic
Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.

Concepts.longName: N Category
Concepts.definition: One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CDSIC aligned NCI Standard CRFs. wz

ValueDomain.preferredName: Breast Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 Pathologic N Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of breast cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system as they pertain to staging of regional lymph nodes._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system.  N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pN3a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pN3a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with metastases in 10 or more axillary lymph nodes (at least one tumor deposit larger than 2.0 mm); or metastases to the infraclavicular (level III axillary) lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pN3a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with metastases in 10 or more axillary lymph nodes (at least one tumor deposit larger than 2.0 mm); or metastases to the infraclavicular (level III axillary) lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pN3c TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pN3c TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with metastases in ipsilateral supraclavicular lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pN3c TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with metastases in ipsilateral supraclavicular lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pN3b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pN3b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with pN1a or pN2a in the presence of cN2b (positive internal mammary nodes by imaging); or pN2a in the presence of pN1b. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pN3b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with pN1a or pN2a in the presence of cN2b (positive internal mammary nodes by imaging); or pN2a in the presence of pN1b. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pN3 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pN3 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with metastases in 10 or more axillary lymph nodes; or in infraclavicular (level III axillary) lymph nodes; or positive ipsilateral internal mammary lymph nodes by imaging in the presence of one or more positive level I, II axillary lymph nodes; or in more than three axillary lymph nodes and micrometastases or macrometastases by sentinel lymph node biopsy in clinically negative ipsilateral internal mammary lymph nodes; or in ipsilateral supraclavicular lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pN3 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with metastases in 10 or more axillary lymph nodes; or in infraclavicular (level III axillary) lymph nodes; or positive ipsilateral internal mammary lymph nodes by imaging in the presence of one or more positive level I, II axillary lymph nodes; or in more than three axillary lymph nodes and micrometastases or macrometastases by sentinel lymph node biopsy in clinically negative ipsilateral internal mammary lymph nodes; or in ipsilateral supraclavicular lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pN2b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pN2b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with metastases in clinically detected internal mammary lymph nodes with or without microscopic confirmation; with pathologically negative axillary nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pN2b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with metastases in clinically detected internal mammary lymph nodes with or without microscopic confirmation; with pathologically negative axillary nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pN2a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pN2a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with metastasis in 4-9 axillary lymph nodes (at least one tumor deposit larger than 2.0 mm). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pN2a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with metastasis in 4-9 axillary lymph nodes (at least one tumor deposit larger than 2.0 mm). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pN2 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pN2 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with metastases in 4-9 axillary lymph nodes; or positive ipsilateral internal mammary lymph nodes by imaging in the absence of axillary lymph node metastases. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pN2 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with metastases in 4-9 axillary lymph nodes; or positive ipsilateral internal mammary lymph nodes by imaging in the absence of axillary lymph node metastases. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pN1mi TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pN1mi TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with micrometastases (approximately 200 cells, larger than 0.2 mm, but none larger than 2.0 mm). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pN1mi TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with micrometastases (approximately 200 cells, larger than 0.2 mm, but none larger than 2.0 mm). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pN1c TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pN1c TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with pN1a and pN1b combined. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pN1c TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with pN1a and pN1b combined. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pN1b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pN1b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with metastases in ipsilateral internal mammary sentinel nodes, excluding ITCs. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pN1b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with metastases in ipsilateral internal mammary sentinel nodes, excluding ITCs. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pN1a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pN1a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with metastases in 1-3 axillary lymph nodes, at least one metastasis larger than 2.0 mm. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pN1a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with metastases in 1-3 axillary lymph nodes, at least one metastasis larger than 2.0 mm. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with micrometastases; or metastases in 1-3 axillary lymph nodes; and/or clinically negative internal mammary nodes with micrometastases or macrometastases by sentinel lymph node biopsy. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with micrometastases; or metastases in 1-3 axillary lymph nodes; and/or clinically negative internal mammary nodes with micrometastases or macrometastases by sentinel lymph node biopsy. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pN0(mol+) TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pN0(mol+) TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with positive molecular findings by reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR); no ITCs detected. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pN0(mol+) TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with positive molecular findings by reverse transcriptase polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR); no ITCs detected. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pN0(i+) TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pN0(i+) TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer with ITCs only (malignant cell clusters no larger than 0.2 mm) in regional lymph node(s). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pN0(i+) TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer with ITCs only (malignant cell clusters no larger than 0.2 mm) in regional lymph node(s). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer in which no regional lymph node metastasis is identified or isolated tumor cell clusters (ITCs) are identified only. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer in which no regional lymph node metastasis is identified or isolated tumor cell clusters (ITCs) are identified only. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Breast Cancer pNX TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Breast Cancer pNX TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Breast cancer in which regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed (e.g., not removed for pathological study or previously removed).  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer pNX TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Breast cancer in which regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed (e.g., not removed for pathological study or previously removed).  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.:A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

Concepts.longName: Breast Cancer Pathologic Regional Lymph Nodes TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of breast cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system as they pertain to staging of regional lymph nodes.

Concepts.longName: American Joint Committee on Cancer
Concepts.definition: A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.

Concepts.longName: N Category
Concepts.definition: One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

Concepts.longName: Category
Concepts.definition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
